title: Getting Newer Tractors Out Into the Fields: Kennedy Implement 2012 Dealership of the Year 1

tasks.task: Operate a tractor dealership in the Pacific Northwest.
subtasks: Sell agricultural equipment (90% of tractors in 100-150 horsepower range)
Rent or loan tractors to customers for short-term use
Educate customers about equipment benefits (e.g., calf check improvements)
Adapt to changing customer needs (e.g., longer machine durability)
Foster customer loyalty through reputation and technology demonstrations

tasks.task: Maintain customer relationships in a small community.
subtasks: Address customers' concerns and provide solutions (e.g., winter preparedness)
Encourage trade-ins and upgrades to keep customers current with technology

tasks.task: Stay competitive in the equipment dealer market.
subtasks: Differentiate through principles of integrity, excellence, and customer focus
Adapt business model to changing market dynamics (e.g., longer machine lifespans)
Invest in customer retention strategies (ongoing relationships, warranty coverage)
Leverage technology-driven solutions to attract and retain customers
